Title: On the hardness of almost–sure termination
Abstract: © Springer-Verlag Berlin Heidelberg 2015.This paper considers the computational hardness of computing expected outcomes and deciding (universal) (positive) almost–sure termination of probabilistic programs. It is shown that computing lower and upper bounds of expected outcomes is Σ0 1– and Σ0 2–complete, respectively. Deciding (universal) almost–sure termination as well as deciding whether the expected outcome of a program equals a given rational value is shown to be Π0 2 –complete. Finally, it is shown that deciding (universal) positive almost–sure termination is Σ0 2–complete (Π0 3–complete).
